communicableDiseases.name: Influenza
communicableDiseases.overview: Influenza, commonly known as the flu, is a contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses.

communicableDiseases.name: COVID-19
communicableDiseases.overview: COVID-19 is an infectious disease caused by the coronavirus SARS-CoV-2.

transmissionPrecautions.classification: Droplet and Contact (with airborne precautions for aerosol-generating procedures)
PPE: N95 or higher-level respirator (for aerosol-generating procedures)

communicableDiseases.name: Tuberculosis
communicableDiseases.overview: Tuberculosis (TB) is a serious infectious disease that primarily affects the lungs.

communicableDiseases.name: Malaria
communicableDiseases.overview: Malaria is a life-threatening disease caused by parasites transmitted through the bites of infected mosquitoes.

communicableDiseases.name: HIV/AIDS
communicableDiseases.overview: HIV (Human Immunodeficiency Virus) attacks the immune system and can lead to AIDS if not treated.

communicableDiseases.name: Measles
communicableDiseases.overview: Measles is a highly contagious viral disease that can cause serious health complications.

communicableDiseases.name: Cholera
communicableDiseases.overview: Cholera is an acute diarrheal illness caused by infection of the intestine with Vibrio cholerae bacteria.

communicableDiseases.name: Dengue Fever
communicableDiseases.overview: Dengue fever is a mosquito-borne viral infection causing flu-like illness and sometimes severe dengue.

communicableDiseases.name: Ebola Virus Disease
communicableDiseases.overview: Ebola virus disease (EVD) is a severe, often fatal illness in humans caused by the Ebola virus.
treatment: Preventive measures like avoiding contact with infected individuals

communicableDiseases.name: Hepatitis B
communicableDiseases.overview: Hepatitis B is a serious liver infection caused by the hepatitis B virus (HBV).
symptoms: Yellowing of the skin and eyes (jaundice)
treatment: Avoiding alcohol and other liver toxins

communicableDiseases.name: Zika Virus
communicableDiseases.overview: Zika virus is a mosquito-borne flavivirus that can cause birth defects when pregnant women are infected.

communicableDiseases.name: Mumps
communicableDiseases.overview: Mumps is a viral infection that primarily affects the salivary glands, causing swelling and pain.

communicableDiseases.name: Polio
communicableDiseases.overview: Polio is a highly infectious viral disease that can lead to paralysis and, in severe cases, death.

communicableDiseases.name: Rubella
communicableDiseases.overview: Rubella, also known as German measles, is a contagious viral infection that is preventable by vaccine.

communicableDiseases.name: Yellow Fever
communicableDiseases.overview: Yellow fever is a viral disease transmitted by mosquitoes, characterized by fever, jaundice, and bleeding.

communicableDiseases.name: Tetanus
communicableDiseases.overview: Tetanus is a serious bacterial infection that causes painful muscle spasms and can lead to death.

communicableDiseases.name: Pertussis (Whooping Cough)
communicableDiseases.overview: Pertussis, or whooping cough, is a highly contagious respiratory disease known for uncontrollable, violent coughing.

communicableDiseases.name: Smallpox
communicableDiseases.overview: Smallpox is a serious and contagious viral disease that has been eradicated globally through vaccination efforts.
symptoms: Rash that progresses to pus-filled sores
treatment: Smallpox vaccination (in the event of exposure)

communicableDiseases.name: Chickenpox (Varicella)
communicableDiseases.overview: Chickenpox is a highly contagious viral infection that causes an itchy rash with red spots and blisters.

communicableDiseases.name: Scarlet Fever
communicableDiseases.overview: Scarlet fever is a bacterial illness that develops in some people who have strep throat. It is characterized by a bright red rash.

communicableDiseases.name: Norovirus
communicableDiseases.overview: Norovirus is a highly contagious virus that causes vomiting and diarrhea. It spreads easily through contaminated food and surfaces.

communicableDiseases.name: RSV (Respiratory Syncytial Virus)
communicableDiseases.overview: RSV is a common respiratory virus that usually causes mild, cold-like symptoms but can be serious in infants and older adults.

communicableDiseases.name: Meningococcal Disease
communicableDiseases.overview: Meningococcal disease is a serious bacterial infection that can cause meningitis or bloodstream infections (septicemia).

communicableDiseases.name: Legionnaires' Disease
communicableDiseases.overview: Legionnaires' disease is a severe form of pneumonia caused by Legionella bacteria, often found in water systems.

communicableDiseases.name: Anthrax
communicableDiseases.overview: Anthrax is a serious infectious disease caused by Bacillus anthracis bacteria. It can affect the skin, lungs, and digestive system.

communicableDiseases.name: Lyme Disease
communicableDiseases.overview: Lyme disease is a bacterial infection spread by ticks, characterized by fever, headache, fatigue, and a characteristic skin rash.

communicableDiseases.name: Toxoplasmosis
communicableDiseases.overview: Toxoplasmosis is a parasitic disease caused by Toxoplasma gondii, often spread through undercooked meat or contact with cat feces.

communicableDiseases.name: Giardiasis
communicableDiseases.overview: Giardiasis is an intestinal infection caused by the parasite Giardia. It spreads through contaminated water or food.

communicableDiseases.name: Cryptosporidiosis
communicableDiseases.overview: Cryptosporidiosis is a diarrheal disease caused by Cryptosporidium, a microscopic parasite that lives in the intestine.

communicableDiseases.name: Hantavirus Pulmonary Syndrome
communicableDiseases.overview: Hantavirus Pulmonary Syndrome (HPS) is a severe, sometimes fatal, respiratory disease in humans caused by hantaviruses.

communicableDiseases.name: Leptospirosis
communicableDiseases.overview: Leptospirosis is a bacterial disease that affects humans and animals. It is caused by bacteria of the genus Leptospira.

communicableDiseases.name: Erysipelas
communicableDiseases.overview: Erysipelas is a bacterial infection of the upper dermis, usually caused by Streptococcus bacteria, leading to red, swollen, and painful skin.

communicableDiseases.name: Q Fever
communicableDiseases.overview: Q fever is a bacterial infection caused by Coxiella burnetii. It is primarily a disease of cattle, sheep, and goats but can infect humans.

communicableDiseases.name: Lassa Fever
communicableDiseases.overview: Lassa fever is an acute viral hemorrhagic illness caused by Lassa virus, often spread by contact with infected rodent urine or droppings.

communicableDiseases.name: Hepatitis A
communicableDiseases.overview: Hepatitis A is a viral liver disease that can cause mild to severe illness. It is primarily transmitted through ingestion of contaminated food and water.

communicableDiseases.name: Hepatitis C
communicableDiseases.overview: Hepatitis C is a liver infection caused by the hepatitis C virus (HCV). It is primarily spread through blood-to-blood contact.
treatment: Avoidance of alcohol and other liver toxins

communicableDiseases.name: Brucellosis
communicableDiseases.overview: Brucellosis is an infectious disease caused by bacteria of the genus Brucella, typically spread through contact with infected animals or animal products.

communicableDiseases.name: Diphtheria
communicableDiseases.overview: Diphtheria is a serious bacterial infection affecting the mucous membranes of the throat and nose, preventable by vaccine.
symptoms: Thick gray coating on the throat and tonsils

communicableDiseases.name: Chikungunya
communicableDiseases.overview: Chikungunya is a viral disease transmitted to humans by infected mosquitoes. It causes fever and severe joint pain.

communicableDiseases.name: Typhoid Fever
communicableDiseases.overview: Typhoid fever is a life-threatening illness caused by the bacterium Salmonella Typhi, transmitted through contaminated food and water.

communicableDiseases.name: Schistosomiasis
communicableDiseases.overview: Schistosomiasis is a parasitic disease caused by blood flukes (trematodes) of the genus Schistosoma. It is spread through contact with contaminated water.

communicableDiseases.name: Leishmaniasis
communicableDiseases.overview: Leishmaniasis is a parasitic disease spread by the bite of infected sand flies. It can cause skin sores or affect internal organs.

communicableDiseases.name: Yersiniosis
communicableDiseases.overview: Yersiniosis is an infection caused by bacteria of the genus Yersinia, usually through contaminated food, particularly raw or undercooked pork.

communicableDiseases.name: Campylobacteriosis
communicableDiseases.overview: Campylobacteriosis is an infection caused by bacteria of the genus Campylobacter, commonly transmitted through contaminated food, especially poultry.

communicableDiseases.name: Toxocariasis
communicableDiseases.overview: Toxocariasis is a parasitic disease caused by larvae of Toxocara roundworms, often spread through contact with contaminated soil or infected animals.
symptoms: Eye pain or vision loss (ocular toxocariasis)

communicableDiseases.name: Trichinellosis
communicableDiseases.overview: Trichinellosis, also known as trichinosis, is a parasitic disease caused by eating raw or undercooked meat, especially pork, infected with Trichinella larvae.

communicableDiseases.name: Ascariasis
communicableDiseases.overview: Ascariasis is a parasitic infection caused by the roundworm Ascaris lumbricoides, commonly spread through contaminated soil or food.

communicableDiseases.name: Onchocerciasis (River Blindness)
communicableDiseases.overview: Onchocerciasis, also known as river blindness, is a parasitic disease caused by infection with Onchocerca volvulus, transmitted through the bite of infected blackflies.

communicableDiseases.name: Filariasis
communicableDiseases.overview: Filariasis is a parasitic disease caused by infection with filarial worms, transmitted through the bites of infected mosquitoes or flies.

communicableDiseases.name: Strongyloidiasis
communicableDiseases.overview: Strongyloidiasis is a parasitic infection caused by the roundworm Strongyloides stercoralis, often spread through contact with contaminated soil.

communicableDiseases.name: Bartonellosis (Cat Scratch Disease)
communicableDiseases.overview: Bartonellosis, also known as cat scratch disease, is an infection caused by bacteria of the genus Bartonella, often transmitted by scratches or bites from infected cats.
symptoms: Blisters or bumps at the site of the scratch or bite

communicableDiseases.name: Plague
communicableDiseases.overview: Plague is a serious bacterial infection caused by Yersinia pestis, often spread through the bites of infected fleas or contact with contaminated fluids.
symptoms: Swollen and painful lymph nodes (bubonic plague)

communicableDiseases.name: Rickettsial Infections (Typhus)
communicableDiseases.overview: Rickettsial infections, including typhus, are caused by bacteria of the genus Rickettsia, transmitted by fleas, lice, ticks, and mites.
treatment: Preventive measures (e.g., insect repellent, avoiding infested areas)

communicableDiseases.name: Zoonotic Influenza
communicableDiseases.overview: Zoonotic influenza refers to influenza viruses that are transmitted from animals to humans, such as avian or swine flu.
treatment: Preventive measures (e.g., vaccination, avoiding contact with infected animals)
